contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox U.S. County | county = Robertson County | state = Kentucky | seal = | founded year = 1867 | founded date = | seat wl = Mount Olivet | largest city wl = | area_total_sq_mi = 100.11 | area_total_km2 = | area_land_sq_mi = 100.07 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_sq_mi = 0.04 | area_water_km2 = | area percentage = 0.04% | census yr = 2000 | pop = 2266 | density_sq_mi = 23 | density_km2 = | time zone = Eastern | UTC offset = -5 | DST offset = -4 | footnotes = | web = www.robertsoncounty.ky.gov | named for = | ex image = Robertson county kentucky courthouse.jpg | ex image cap = Robertson County courthouse in Mount Olivet, Kentucky }} '''Robertson County''' is a [[County (USA)|county]] located in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Kentucky]]. As of 2010, the population was 2,282. Its [[county seat]] is [[Mount Olivet, Kentucky]]{{GR|6}}. The county is named for [[George Robertson (congressman)|George Robertson]], a Kentucky Congressman from 1817 to 1821. Robertson is a prohibition or [[dry county]]. It is the smallest county by population and total area in Kentucky. ==Geography== According to the 2000 census, the county has a total area of {{convert|100.11|sqmi}}, the smallest county in Kentucky, of which {{convert|100.07|sqmi}} (or 99.96%) is land and {{convert|0.04|sqmi}} (or 0.04%) is water.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.census.gov/tiger/tms/gazetteer/county2k.txt |title=Census 2000 U.S. Gazetteer Files: Counties |publisher=United States Census |accessdate=2011-02-13 }}</ref> ===Adjacent counties=== *[[Bracken County, Kentucky|Bracken County]] (north) *[[Mason County, Kentucky|Mason County]] (northeast) *[[Fleming County, Kentucky|Fleming County]] (southeast) *[[Nicholas County, Kentucky|Nicholas County]] (south) *[[Harrison County, Kentucky|Harrison County]] (west) ==History== Robertson County was formed on February 11, 1867 from portions of Bracken County, Harrison County, Mason County and Nicholas County. It was named after [[George Robertson (congressman)|George Robertson]], a judge and member of Congress. ==Demographics== {{USCensusPop | 1870= 5399 | 1880= 5814 | 1890= 4684 | 1900= 4900 | 1910= 4121 | 1920= 3871 | 1930= 3344 | 1940= 3419 | 1950= 2881 | 1960= 2443 | 1970= 2163 | 1980= 2265 | 1990= 2124 | 2000= 2266 | 2010= 2282 | estimate= | estyear= | estref= | footnote=http://ukcc.uky.edu/~census/21201.txt }} As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 2,266 people, 866 households, and 621 families residing in the county, making it the least populated county in the state. The [[population density]] was {{convert|23|/sqmi|/km2}}. There were 1,034 housing units at an average density of {{convert|10|/sqmi|/km2}}. The racial makeup of the county was 98.63% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 0.04% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.04% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.22% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.06% from two or more races. 0.93% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 866 households out of which 31.10% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 57.60% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 9.10% had a female householder with no husband present, and 28.20% were non-families. 24.70% of all households were made up of individuals and 11.10% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.54 and the average family size was 3.00. In the county the population was spread out with 23.80% under the age of 18, 6.70% from 18 to 24, 27.10% from 25 to 44, 25.50% from 45 to 64, and 16.90% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 40 years. For every 100 females there were 94.80 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 92.50 males. The median income for a household in the county was $30,581, and the median income for a family was $35,521. Males had a median income of $27,656 versus $20,476 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the county was $13,404. About 17.50% of families and 22.20% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 30.30% of those under age 18 and 24.10% of those age 65 or over. ==Cities and towns== *[[Kentontown, Kentucky|Kentontown]] *[[Mount Olivet, Kentucky|Mount Olivet]] *[[Piqua, Kentucky|Piqua]] ==See also== *[[National Register of Historic Places listings in Kentucky#Robertson County|National Register of Historic Places listings in Robertson County, Kentucky]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Portal|Kentucky}} {{Robertson County, Kentucky}} {{Kentucky}} {{Coord|38.51|-84.05|display=title|type:adm2nd_region:US-KY_source:UScensus1990}} [[Category:Kentucky counties]] [[Category:Robertson County, Kentucky| ]] [[Category:Dry counties of Kentucky]] [[Category:Counties in Appalachia]]
